sentences.sentence: Hermes and the Workmen
A workman, cutting wood by the side of a river, accidentally( 意外地 ) dropped his ax into a deep pool.
Losing his only way of making money, he sat down and started to cry.
Hermes appeared and asked why he was crying.
After he told him what had happened, Hermes jumped into the pool, and brought up a golden ax.
He then asked if that was the ax he had lost.
When he said that it was not his, Hermes went under the water a second time,
and returned with a silver ax in his hand.
He again asked the workman if it was his.
When the workman said it was not, he jumped into the pool for the third time and brought up the ax that he had lost.
The workman took it and was glad to get it back.
Hermes, pleased with his honesty, also gave him the golden and silver axes.
When the workman got home, he told his friends what had happened.
One of them soon decided to try and get the same good fortune( 财富 ) for himself.
He ran to the river and threw his ax into the pool, and sat down on the bank to cry.
Hermes appeared to him just as he hoped he would.
Having learned the reason why he was sad, he jumped into the pool and brought up a golden ax.
He then asked if the man had lost it.
The workman grabbed( 抓住 ) it and said that it was the same ax that he had lost.
Hermes, disappointed by his lie, not only took away the golden ax, but refused to return the ax he had thrown into the pool.
MORAL: Honesty is the best policy.
The Hare( 野兔 ) and the Dog
A dog, having chased( 追赶 ) a hare( 野兔 ) for a long distance, stopped running.
A farmer, seeing him stop, laughed and said, “The little one is the better runner of the two.”
The dog replied, “You do not see the difference between us;
I was only running for a dinner, but he was running for his life.”
MORAL: The greater the need, the greater the effort.
The Hare( 野兔 ) and the Tortoise( 乌龟 )
A hare( 野兔 ) one day laughed at( 嘲笑 ) the short feet and slowness of a tortoise( 乌龟 ).
The tortoise( 乌龟 ), laughing, said, “Though you are as fast as the wind, I will beat you in a race.”
The hare( 野兔 ), thinking this to be simply impossible, accepted the challenge( 挑战 ).
On the day of the race, they started together.
The tortoise( 乌龟 ) never stopped, but walked slowly and steadily( 稳步地，稳定地 ) to the end of the course.
The hare( 野兔 ), believing he was faster, cared little about the race.
He lay down by the side of the road and fell asleep.
When he woke up( 醒来 ), he ran as fast as he could, but the tortoise( 乌龟 ) had already finished and was sleeping at the finish line.
MORAL: Slow and steady( 稳定 ) wins the race.
The Hares( 野兔 ) and the Frogs( 青蛙 )
A group of hares( 野兔 ), fed up with( 对...厌倦 ) always being afraid and always being in danger,
decided to end their lives by jumping off a high cliff( 悬崖 ) into a deep lake below.
As many of them ran towards the edge to their death,
the frogs( 青蛙 ) lying beside the lake heard the noise of their feet, and jumped into the deep water for safety.
Seeing the frogs( 青蛙 ) disappear quickly, one of the hares said to the others,
“Stay, my friends, don’t jump! See—other animals are even more afraid than we are.”
MORAL: We are encouraged by seeing others who are worse off( 更差 ) than ourselves.

question.cn: 在故事“Hermes and the Workmen”中，为什么Hermes会把金斧子和银斧子都给了第一个人？
question.en: In the story Hermes and the Workmen, why did Hermes give the first man the golden and silver axes?

analysis: 文中提到，“Hermes, pleased with his honesty, also gave him the golden and silver axes”可知Hermes 认为这个人很诚实，所以把金斧子和银斧子都送给了他, 因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事 the Hare and the Dog 中，狗为什么要追赶野兔？
question.en: In the story the Hare and the Dog, why did the dog chase the hare?

options.en: The dog wanted to play with the hare.
The dog wanted to eat the hare.

analysis: 文中提到：“I was running for a dinner, but he was running for his life.”可知狗追赶野兔是为了吃掉他，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Hare and the Tortoise中，为什么兔子要嘲笑乌龟？
question.en: In the story the Hare and the Tortoise, why did the hare laugh at the tortoise?

options.cn: 因为短腿的乌龟跑得慢。
options.en: Because the tortoise with short feet ran slowly.
Because the tortoise had a hard shell.

analysis: 文中提到：“A hare one day laughed at the short feet and slowness of a tortoise. ”可知兔子嘲笑乌龟腿短跑得慢，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Hare and the Tortoise中，比赛过程中发生了什么？
question.en: In the story the Hare and the Tortoise, what happened during the race?

options.en: The hare fell into a big hole.

analysis: 文中提到：“the hare, believing he was faster, cared little about the race. He lay down by the side of the road and fell asleep.”兔子在比赛过程中睡着了，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事 The Hares and the Frogs 中，兔子们为什么决定从悬崖跳下去？
question.en: In the story the Hares and the Frogs, why did those hares decide to jump off a high cliff into a deep lake?

options.en: They wanted to catch some frogs.

options.cn: 他们受够了经常担惊受怕的日子，想结束他们的生命。
options.en: They were tired of being afraid and in danger, and wanted to end their lives.
They did that just for fun.

analysis: 文中提到：“a group of hares, fed up with always being afraid and always being in danger, decided to ... ”厌烦了经常担惊受怕的日子，兔子们决定跳崖自杀，因此选B。
